meanings.sent1: She is known for her antielitist views on education.
meanings.sent2: The antielitist group protested against the unfair treatment of students.
meanings.sent3: The antielitist teacher joked that only the cool kids get to sit at the front of the class.
meanings.sent4: His antielitist attitude towards social gatherings made him stand out in the crowd.
meanings.sent5: The antielitist movement aimed to make education accessible to all.

meanings.sent1: As an antielitist, she believed in equal opportunities for everyone.
meanings.sent2: The antielitist spoke out against the unfair advantages given to the wealthy.
meanings.sent3: The antielitist at the party made sure everyone had a chance to share their opinions.
meanings.sent4: He was seen as an antielitist warrior fighting for the rights of the common people.
meanings.sent5: The antielitist's passion for justice inspired others to join the cause.
